div.head: TO THE RIGHT WORSHIPFVLL Dr BRENT, Dr OF THE CIVILL LAWES, THE WORTHIE WARDEN OF MERTON COLLEDGE.
div.p:
I Haue done that here, which intruth I never thought to haue done; Namely put my selfe vpon the publique censure for a Sermon: For I knowe, and well consider the superabundancy of this kinde of writing, wherewith the world may seeme not more instructed,
then opprest. But the maine reason that draue me on this determination, was a fitnesse here of the argument with the times; in which case alone (to speake my minde) I haue ever thought such discourses, at leastwise excusable, if divulged; Especially when as too the argument thus taken in hand happens a little besides the vsuall roade: not trauers'd and debated in every treatise. Vpon this ground, or howsoever I was perswaded, hauing perchance resolu'd of a publication. I knewe not to whom I could more iustly entitle this Schedule, then to your selfe. First for the particular respect I owe you, and then by reason of my collegiate duty in which I stand bound. Please you then Sir, but to accept of these my first fruits: It may bee hereafter I shall bee able to vndertake some one thing or other, which may better deserue your name and patronage. Meane while I remaine, as ever,

closer.signed: Yours in all due obseruance, IOHN DOVGHTY.
